headline.main: Doctors Debate: Should City Aid Growth in Palliative Care?

docs.abstract: Two New York City doctors, the head of the city's largest public hospital and a nationally known geriatrician, gently clashed at a City Council hearing to discuss how to deal with the growing demand for end-of-life care.
docs.lead_paragraph: Just how far should medicine go in turning death and dying into a growth industry?
docs.snippet: Two New York City doctors, the head of the city's largest public hospital and a nationally known geriatrician, gently clashed at a City Council hearing to discuss how to deal with the growing demand for end-of-life care.

headline.seo: Ricky Williams’s 3 Touchdowns Lead Dolphins Past Panthers

docs.lead_paragraph: With Ronnie Brown out, Ricky Williams scored three touchdowns as the Dolphins beat the Panthers for their fifth win in seven games.
docs.snippet: With Ronnie Brown out, Ricky Williams scored three touchdowns as the Dolphins beat the Panthers for their fifth win in seven games.

docs.abstract: Study conducted by Emory University Prof Kenneth Thorpe suggests that Congressional efforts to slow growth of health care spending may be overwhelmed by surging prevalance of obesity; says explosion of chronic disease, not technology, is driving health care spending; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: While Congress searches for ways to slow the growth of health care spending, a new study suggests that its efforts may be overwhelmed by the surging prevalence of obesity. The report, issued Tuesday, projects that if current trends continue, 103 million American adults will be considered obese by 2018. That would be 43 percent of adults, compared with 31 percent in 2008, according to the research by Kenneth E. Thorpe, a professor of public health at Emory University and an authority on the cost of treating chronic disease.
docs.snippet: While Congress searches for ways to slow the growth of health care spending, a new study suggests that its efforts may be overwhelmed by the surging prevalence of obesity.     The report, issued Tuesday, projects that if current trends continue, 103...
